title: Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts: Get Involved
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved           Get Involved       You can support Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts in many ways. There are activities that can be done all year long such as hiking on the trails, becoming a Junior Ranger, and attending ranger programs. In the summer you can attend a performance or special event along with activities available year-round. For more information visit the Things to Do section.   Volunteer at Wolf Trap in one of our many opportunities around the park.   Work at Wolf Trap. The park hires many temporary summer employees and on occasion permanent positions. Summer employees are primarily hired to help with the performances.   Donate to Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts. The park may accept donations. Your contribution will be used to support the National Park Service programs of the only park in the nation dedicated to the performing arts.   Support the Wolf Trap Foundation for the Performing Arts. The Wolf Trap Foundation is the co-management partner with Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts. They are a 501(c)3 non-profit organization.    Join and support the Friends of Wolf Trap. The Friends of Wolf Trap support efforts to enhance the greater potential for the study and preservation of natural resources, local history, and outdoor recreational uses not directly related to performance at Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts. They are a 501(c)3 non-profit organization.   Join and support the Potomac Appalachian Trail Club (PATC). The Potomac Appalachian Trail Club is a 100% Volunteer-Supported 501(c)3 non-profit formed for the purpose of building and maintaining the Appalachian Trail (AT) and other regional trail, including those at Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts   How will you get involved at Wolf Trap?
